Description: Handle and body sherd of Aeolian grey ware pottery vessel, krater or hydria; interior reserved; exterior: worn black slip; three incision lines running along outside of horizontal handle; decoration in relief to inside of handle root, palmette and part of tendril.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.644.g and 1888,0601.644.k. The sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton. Schlotzhauer points out that similar palmette decoration is not uncommon on East Greek wares, notably on Fikellura amphora and that grey wares were popular in North Ionia and Aeolis.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (GL.126)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 74-5, NAU 2, pl. 1 b.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.176)
